result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert T. Ely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Barbara Hedrick.

Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court re-imposes cost not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:05 pm case called. Defendant Robert T. Ely in court with attorney Brian T. Kane.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. No corrections or errors. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Kane. Court sentences the defendant to: 160 days WCJ on each count, concurrent to each other.  Credit for 120 days served. Court re-imposes costs not previously paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

10:53 am cases called. 15CM166 & 15CM191. Defendant Robert T. Ely in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 & 2-15CM166. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 15CM191. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: COUNT 1 ONLY- 52 days WCJ with 52 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS on both counts-AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with Barbara Hedrick. DAAP and follow through, Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

State's

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:07 p.m. Defendant Robert T. Ely in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi with the exception of the no contact condition. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
